Conduct Of Public Officials And Employees

law.catch_line: Candidates For Employment As State Employee; Disclosure Of Relation To State Employee
law.text: [ Text of section added by 2011, 93, Sec. 118 effective July 1, 2011. See 2011, 93, Sec. 138.] Each candidate for employment as a state employee shall be required by the hiring authority as part of the application process to disclose, in writing, the names of any state employee who is related to the candidate as: spouse, parent, child or sibling or the spouse of the candidate's parent, child or sibling. The contents of a disclosure received under this section from an employee when such employee was a candidate shall be considered public records under section 7 of chapter 4 and chapter 66. All disclosures made by applicants hired by a state agency shall be made available for public inspection to the extent permissible by law by the official with whom such disclosure has been filed.
